raw_text:
Blues slam Blackburn over Savage
 
 Birmingham have confirmed Blackburn made a bid for Robbie Savage - but managing director Karen Brady has called it "derisory".
 
 Rovers have reportedly offered £500,000 up front for the Wales star, 30, with the fee rising to £2.2m. But Brady told The Sun the bid was "a waste of fax paper and my time". She added: "The way things are going all this could affect the relationship between the clubs. They've got into Robbie's head. But he's not for sale." Savage's future at Birmingham has been the source of speculation for several weeks, with some fans criticising his performances for the club earlier in the season. However, good displays against West Brom and Aston Villa have impressed Blues fans. "The crowd gave me a massive standing ovation when I came off on Saturday which was nice," he said. "It was fantastic even though I was criticised by a number of them in recent weeks and on Saturday it showed how much I mean to them. "It's not for me to say (about transfer rumours), it's between the two clubs. "I haven't created the speculation myself, I haven't phoned every national newspaper saying, 'Blackburn are trying to buy me'. It's not up to me." Birmingham manager Steve Bruce insists he does not want to sell Savage. "A lot is said and written about Sav but he has been terrific for Birmingham City the last two and a half years," he said.
 
 "The fans love him because he epitomises them. He works hard, They like people like that and there are not many like him. "And why the hell should I sell him to someone else? I am not interested."
llama3.2:1b: Birmingham manager Karen Brady has rejected a £2.2m bid from Blackburn for Robbie Savage, describing it as "derisory" due to concerns about their relationship.
Despite speculation that Savage may be leaving Birmingham, his future at the club seems secure.
Manager Steve Bruce also rejects the idea of selling Savage, citing his on-field performances and fan support.
llama3.2:3b: Birmingham City managing director Karen Brady has rejected a £2.2m bid from Blackburn for Robbie Savage, calling it "derisory".
Savage's future at the club has been speculated due to poor performances earlier in the season, but good recent displays have won over fans.
Manager Steve Bruce insists he doesn't want to sell Savage, saying he's "terrific" and a key part of the team who embodies the club's spirit.

Brady confirmed she believes Blackburn have tried to manipulate Savage into considering a move.
The player himself stated he's not for sale and has received support from fans.
Birmingham manager Steve Bruce also denied interest in selling Savage.

• Rovers have offered £500, 000 up front for Savage.
• Fans believe Savage is not available and speculation is high about his future at Birmingham City.
• Steven Bruce believes he doesn't want to sell Savage.
• Fans love him as a defender, because he works hard and everyone likes people like that.

Fans appreciate Savage despite criticism during his tenure at Birmingham; manager Bruce insists he doesn't want to sell Savage.
qwen2.5:3b: Blues deny Blackburn's £500,000 bid for Robbie Savage, who has impressed with recent performances.
Despite speculation, Savage insists he hasn't initiated transfer rumors and maintains strong support from Birmingham fans.
Manager Steve Bruce confirms the club does not want to sell Savage.

tinyllama:1.1b: According to Birmingham Football Club's management team, Manchester United and Chelsea have both made offers for Robbie Savage, but the Bluebirds have reportedly offered a wretched £500,000 up front.
However, Blues boss Karen Bradley claims this bid is "waste of fax paper and my time".
She also insists that transfer rumours surrounding Savage are false and does not want to sell him.
The Rovers' fan base has been vocal in their praise for the Welsh star, but some fans have criticized his performances for the club.
Despite the transfer rumors, Savage was hailed by many for good performances against West Brom and Villa.
The Blues boss is reportedly not interested in selling him to any of the two clubs mentioned, stating that he is not for sale.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Birmingham manager Steve Bruce insists he does not want to sell Robbie Savage, stating that the fans love him because of his dedication and hard work.
He claims that the Blues have reached out to Blackburn Rovers regarding a potential bid for the Wales international but has yet to make an official offer.
However, Brady, the managing director of Birmingham, seems unimpressed by Savage's current form and criticized him earlier in the season.
Despite this, it is not clear what the outcome of the negotiations will be as both clubs have been reluctant to comment on the situation.
